title: Ralph Steadman-like hand-drawn serif script included w/ MS Office
content:
Hey guys,

I installed Office today and this font as well as Jungle took over Firefox. I found Jungle in my Font Book and disabled it, but this one eludes me. It’s not showing up in my Web Collection which is kind of weird.

Ideas?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211524/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_45.jpg) | 47.58 KB |

 [‹ (x) Dart Distribution decorative display type - Kino {David Hamuel}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211524/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43462 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) On Air Design logo simple sans - Frutiger {Florian} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211524/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43496 "Go to next forum topic")
author: seand

comments.content: I would rather do it by hand, It’s an ugly font

I guess Sean rather wants to get rid off this ‘beauty’.  
Emptying your font cache(s) might help. FontExplorer X can do this, it’s free. Or Font Finagler (shareware).

I guess that font has a time and a place. Kind of gives off a Ralph Steadman-ey vibe. I still haven’t found that font in my font book, but FontExplorer X clearing the cache did the trick.

Thanks for the tip.
